Jeff Kaplan did NOT die for this.

I have been with Overwatch since 2017 and up till 2019 were truly the glory days. For an FPS game to get GOTY was a big deal and OW had a lot of potential. Alas Blizzard happened and we only went downhill since 2020 and here we are now.
Players were promised PVE which made PVP balance and support lacklustre for years and then they finally went on to reveal there was NO proper PVE developed either. Just a cashgrab F2P model that forces aggressive micro-transactions.
RIP Overwatch, you will be forever missed. This illegitimate child called ow2 spawned by the devs is destined for nothing but doomğŸ•º

ã€‚

cat

Once upon a time, I had a cat, I had ten dollars, I would buy it food for eight dollars, bathe it often, and it was very sticky to me.

Later, I took it out to play, passers-by thought it was cute, they fed it cat food, ham sausage, I was very unhappy because it was mine. I wanted to carry it home, but he broke away from me and meowed at the person who gave it good food, I hugged him a few times and he didn't go with me, and scratched me, so I turned around and left.....

Later, I came across it by chance on the road, and it was dirty. Passers-by will only give it good food and play with it, but they will not take it home and bathe it. It saw me and followed me home, I shut it out, it meowed outside the door, it was very uncomfortable,
but I wouldn't want it anymore
.

This game is text-book definition of corporate greed. 

-Overpriced skins

-Locking new heroes behind a pay wall or a grind (battlefront 2 anyone?)

-Filling half of all already overpriced bundles and battlepasses with fluff nobody wants

-the battlepass has no way to pay itself back (partly or fully) like most other games


And all of this I could have forgiven IF the pve that they added was free but they didn't. They've just released 3 parts of the pve story and it's a standard bundle of â‚¬15.

Besides all that, the reason why I still play it is because there's no other game like this, people might suggest paladins or team fortress 2, while they're fun they're still too different imo.

Blizzard literally took a massive dump on the IP and the fans of this franchise.

Now it's time for me to take a massive dump on them.

They locked the story missions behind a paywall. The main reason to even look at this requires you to spend money on it.

It's not just cosmetics they put behind a paywall, or heroes. But you now, in a free to play game, pay for the privilege to play the selling point of the update, a PVE mode which was promised to us way back when the game was announced. Imagine if Versus Saxton Hale was behind a pay wall when the summer update was released, or new Apex Legends maps and game modes could only be accessed by paying for them. Blizzard has fallen far, but knowing them they can fall even further.
game is fun! but blizzard is trying to make this game as predatory as a shitty mobile. sad to see a game that was once compared to TF2 get so low

[h1]Si Blizzard no hiciese de las suyas, esta cosa seria mucho mejor de lo que es y pudo haber sido[/h1]

No llevo jugando mucho tiempo a Overwatch como tal, empece por ahi de Marzo de este aÃ±o y desde entonces no he parado,  el juego es una joya por su cuenta y tiene una cantidad de puntos a favor que es bestial, [b]el juego realmente pudo haber sido mucho mas de lo que es ahora[/b] pero ese afan de Blizzard de tomar decisiones tan nefastas, ya imagino que muchos "ACTOS" que han cometido te pudren la cabeza y dejas de pensar normalmente por que a decir verdad, creo que no es normal ver un desperdicio de oportunidades tan grande como Overwatch con Blizzard.

Tan solo con ver a toooodo el departamento referente al arte en el juego, algunas skins son decentes y otras son buenisimas, mis favoritas siguen siendo skins que llevan lore consigo (por no decir todo Blackwatch), las animaciones que le han hecho al juego que, es buenisima, ya es normal ver gente pidiendo si no es que ROGANDO una serie o mas produccion de cortos animados sobre el juego, es que simplemente son una joya y no puedo pensar en uno solo que halla sido malo o siquiera "decente" pero bueno.
No puedo ni quiero esperar mucho de Microsoft, pero imaginare que una compra que tiene mas dinero que el salario que yo generare en 200 vidas tendra como resultado que este juego este en un estado minimamente disfrutable, todo el potencial que tenia ya murio hace mucho tiempo y lo menos que se puede rescatar es que el juego sea disfrutable, y aun asi estaria pidiendo demasiado.

En resumen, OW es un juego que se le pudo haber exprimido mucho jugo, el unico problema fue que Blizzard fueran sus dueÃ±os.
Eso si, Lucio y Ana mejor support, Sombra la mejor DPS y nadie el mejor tanque, no jueguen tanque.
Hey Blizzard, that's how it looks when you can't pay for the reviews. Would be interesting to see the rating of "your critically acclaimed" Diablo 4 game on steam.

my favorite part was when reaper said "BUY, BUY, BUY!" and implemented microtransactions
